The location matched the host's description and our expectations.
Being a loft space, privacy is lessened compared to a more traditional residence--the room walls do not reach the building's roof, so sound carries throughout the entire space. This isn't an issue if you know what to expect, but some folks who signed the guestbook apparently did not anticipate this when booking.
We stayed during a spectacular total solar eclipse in the city, and this space provided a location that was easily walkable to the main community celebration and to some of the local restaurants and shops. The shortage of lodging in the area for the event drove up prices for accommodations, but this listing offered a relatively reasonable value compared to other nearby options.
The host was very friendly, and her responses to any questions we had were prompt and helpful.
This was our first Airbnb stay, and we can only hope that future bookings will be as smooth and pleasant as Jessica helped make this one.

Grace's Downtown Loft Apartment is better than the description.

The decor is industrial (open beam ceiling) meets country chic (adorable chalk painted retro outside/modern inside refrigerator), meets glam (gorgeous lighting and massive clawfoot soaking tub). Her style is impeccable.
No worries if you forgot something because Grace certainly did not. There are plenty of closets with hangers, a filtered water pitcher, a basket of hair clips by the soaking tub, 3 types of hair curling irons, clothes iron and steamer, a variety of book genres, comfy sofas and beds, lots of towels, and new kitchen appliances.
There is plenty of parking nearby. The ability to carry your luggage up a high staircase is a must.
I'll no longer select the Hampton. Grace is truly a super host!
